DataElement.preferredName: Chronic Graft Versus Host Disease Assessment Involvement Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the chronic graft versus host disease involvement.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Chronic Graft Versus Host Disease Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The assessment of the transplant recipient for signs and symptoms of chronic Graft versus Host Disease (GVHD).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A disease or condition that persists or progresses over a long period of time.:Graft-versus-host disease. A reaction of donated bone marrow or peripheral stem cells against a person's tissue.

Concepts.definition: Usually used to describe a condition that is persistent and long standing.
Graft-versus-host disease. A reaction of donated bone marrow or peripheral stem cells against a person's tissue.

Property.preferredDefinition: The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Graft Versus Host Disease Involvement Type
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A reaction, which may be fatal, in an immunocompromised subject (host) who has received an antigenically incompatible tissue transplant (graft) from an immunocompetent donor. The reaction is secondary to the activation of the transplanted cells against those host tissues that express an antigen not expressed by the donor, and is seen most commonly following bone marrow transplantation; acute disease is seen after 5-40 days, and chronic disease occurs weeks to months after transplantation._To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process._Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A large organ located in the upper abdomen. The liver cleanses the blood and aids in digestion by secreting bile.

Concepts.definition: A triangular-shaped organ located under the diaphragm in the right hypochondrium. It is the largest internal organ of the body, weighting up to 2 kg. Metabolism and bile secretion are its main functions. It is composed of cells which have the ability to regenerate.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2023.3.7 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0002119. ak

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A condition in which the number of eosinophils (a type of white blood cell) in the blood is greatly increased. Eosinophilia is often a response to infection or allergens (substances that cause an allergic response).

Concepts.definition: Abnormal high level of eosinophils in the blood.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Inflammation of the bronchioles with obstruction by fibrous granulation tissue or bronchial exudate. It may follow inhalation of irritating gases or foreign bodies and it complicates pneumonia.

Concepts.definition: Inflammation of the bronchioles with obstruction by fibrous granulation tissue or bronchial exudate. It may follow inhalation of irritating gases or foreign bodies and it complicates pneumonia.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Abnormal immunoproteins that act against the body's own tissues because they have been mistakenly identified as being foreign.

Concepts.definition: An antibody acting against tissues of the organism that produces it.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A reduction in overall body mass.

Concepts.definition: A reduction in total body weight.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Inflammation of a serous membrane.

Concepts.definition: Inflammation of a serous membrane.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned._A unique macroscopic (gross) anatomic structure that performs specific functions. It is composed of various tissues.  An organ is part of an anatomic system or a body region. Representative examples include the heart, lung, liver, spleen, and uterus._To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

A unique macroscopic (gross) anatomic structure that performs specific functions. It is composed of various tissues.  An organ is part of an anatomic system or a body region. Representative examples include the heart, lung, liver, spleen, and uterus.
To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not otherwise specified.: One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has but two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border. SYN pulmo.: To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border.
To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not otherwise specified.: Pertaining to or related to the formation of blood cells.: To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
Pertaining to or related to the formation of blood cells.
To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The upper gastrointestinal (GI) tract is comprised of mouth, pharynx, esophagus and stomach while the lower GI tract consists of intestines and anus. The primary function of the GI tract is to ingest, digest, absorb and ultimately excrete food stuff.

Concepts.definition: The upper gastrointestinal (GI) tract is comprised of mouth, pharynx, esophagus and stomach while the lower GI tract consists of intestines and anus. The primary function of the GI tract is to ingest, digest, absorb and ultimately excrete food stuff.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The body system that includes all organs involved in reproduction and in the formation and voidance of urine.

Concepts.definition: The body system that includes all organs involved in reproduction and in the formation and voidance of urine.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned._An organ that constitutes the external surface of the body. It consists of the epidermis, dermis, and skin appendages._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._The filamentous outgrowth of the epidermis._To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
An organ that constitutes the external surface of the body. It consists of the epidermis, dermis, and skin appendages.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
The filamentous outgrowth of the epidermis.
To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Having to do with muscles, bones, and cartilage.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to the muscles and skeleton.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A condition in which there is an abnormally small number of platelets in the circulating blood.

Concepts.definition: A laboratory test result indicating that there is an abnormally small number of platelets in the circulating blood.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The organ of sight or vision.

Concepts.definition: The organ of sight or vision.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated concept definition to use current NCIt. 4.5.18 mc

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The cavity lying at the upper end of the alimentary canal, bounded on the outside by the lips and inside by the oropharynx and containing in humans the tongue, gums, and teeth.

Concepts.definition: The cavity located at the upper end of the alimentary canal, behind the teeth and gums that is bounded on the outside by the lips, above by the hard and soft palates and below by the tongue.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Watery bowel movements.

Concepts.definition: Watery bowel movements.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Permanent shortening of a joint, usually resulting from prolonged spasticity in a muscle area.

Concepts.definition: Permanent shortening of a joint, usually resulting from prolonged spasticity in a muscle area.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A generalized inflammatory cutaneous disorder characterized by erythema and desquamation.

Concepts.definition: A generalized inflammatory cutaneous disorder characterized by erythema and desquamation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The lower part of the gastrointestinal tract that includes the jejunum and ileum of the small intestine and the large intestine.

Concepts.definition: The lower part of the gastrointestinal tract that includes the jejunum and ileum of the small intestine and the large intestine.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The upper part of the gastrointestinal tract that includes the esophagus, stomach, and duodenum.

Concepts.definition: The upper part of the gastrointestinal tract that includes the esophagus, stomach, and duodenum.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An organ that constitutes the external surface of the body. It consists of the epidermis, dermis, and skin appendages.: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.: A sheet or band of fibrous connective tissue enveloping, separating, or binding together muscles, organs, and other soft structures of the body.: A pathological hardening or thickening of tissue, especially that of the interstitial substance.

Concepts.definition: An organ that constitutes the external surface of the body. It consists of the epidermis, dermis, and skin appendages.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
A sheet or band of fibrous connective tissue enveloping, separating, or binding together muscles, organs, and other soft structures of the body.
A pathological hardening or thickening of tissue, especially that of the interstitial substance.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The connection point between two bones or skeletal elements. The joint may be fixed or movable.: An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.: A sheet or band of fibrous connective tissue enveloping, separating, or binding together muscles, organs, and other soft structures of the body.

Concepts.definition: The connection point between two bones or skeletal elements. The joint may be fixed or movable.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
A sheet or band of fibrous connective tissue enveloping, separating, or binding together muscles, organs, and other soft structures of the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A disorder affecting the peripheral nervous system. It manifests with pain, tingling, numbness, and muscle weakness. It may be the result of physical injury, toxic substances, viral diseases, diabetes, renal failure, cancer, and drugs.

Concepts.definition: A disorder affecting the peripheral nervous system. It manifests with pain, tingling, numbness, and muscle weakness. It may be the result of physical injury, toxic substances, viral diseases, diabetes, renal failure, cancer, and drugs.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The determination of the number of platelets in a blood sample, usually expressed as platelets per cubic millimeter (cmm) of whole blood.

Concepts.definition: The determination of the number of platelets in a biospecimen.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Diseases characterized by inflammation involving multiple muscles. This may occur as an acute or chronic condition associated with medication toxicity (DRUG TOXICITY, NERVOUS SYSTEM); CONNECTIVE TISSUE DISEASES; infections; malignant NEOPLASMS; and other disorders. The term polymyositis is frequently used to refer to a specific clinical entity characterized by subacute or slowly progressing symmetrical weakness primarily affecting the proximal limb and trunk muscles. The illness may occur at any age, but is most frequent in the fourth to sixth decade of life. Weakness of pharyngeal and laryngeal muscles, interstitial lung disease, and inflammation of the myocardium may also occur. Muscle biopsy reveals widespread destruction of segments of muscle fibers and an inflammatory cellular response. (Adams et al., Principles of Neurology, 6th ed, pp1404-9)

Concepts.definition: An idiopathic inflammatory disorder affecting the muscles. It presents with symmetrical proximal muscle weakness and elevated skeletal muscle enzymes.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A chronic autoimmune neuromuscular disorder characterized by skeletal muscle weakness.  It is caused by the blockage of the acetylcholine receptors at the neuromuscular junction.

Concepts.definition: A chronic autoimmune neuromuscular disorder characterized by skeletal muscle weakness. It is caused by the blockage of the acetylcholine receptors at the neuromuscular junction.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Clinical association of heavy PROTEINURIA, HYPOALBUMINEMIA, and generalized EDEMA.

Concepts.definition: A collection of symptoms that include severe edema, proteinuria, and hypoalbuminemia; it is indicative of renal dysfunction.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Increased amounts of fluid within the pleural cavity. Symptoms include shortness of breath, cough, and chest pain. It is usually caused by lung infections, congestive heart failure, pleural and lung tumors, connective tissue disorders, and trauma.

Concepts.definition: Increased amounts of fluid within the pleural cavity. Symptoms include shortness of breath, cough, and chest pain. It is usually caused by lung infections, congestive heart failure, pleural and lung tumors, connective tissue disorders, and trauma.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The accumulation of fluid in the peritoneal cavity, which may be serous, hemorrhagic, or the result of tumor metastasis to the peritoneum.

Concepts.definition: The accumulation of fluid in the peritoneal cavity, which may be serous, hemorrhagic, or the result of tumor metastasis to the peritoneum.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Fluid collection within the pericardial sac, usually due to inflammation.

Concepts.definition: Fluid collection within the pericardial sac, usually due to inflammation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: No person or thing, nobody, not any.

Concepts.definition: No person or thing, nobody, not any.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An organ that constitutes the external surface of the body. It consists of the epidermis, dermis, and skin appendages.

Concepts.definition: An organ that constitutes the external surface of the body. It consists of the epidermis, dermis, and skin appendages.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The organs and tissues involved in the production and maturation of gametes and in their union and subsequent development as offspring.

Concepts.definition: The organs and tissues involved in the production and maturation of gametes and in their union and subsequent development as offspring.

The reaction is secondary to the activation of the transplanted cells against those host tissues that express an antigen not expressed by the donor, and is seen most commonly following bone marrow transplantation; acute disease is seen after 5-40 days, and chronic disease occurs weeks to months after transplantation.:To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.:Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
